Text:
Encoding quality A/V is great, I have nothing to argue about it, but (I'll make an exception here, as I usually don't like to comment on the movie script or directing) the movie itself gave me an ache in the stomach. The movie poster says "The best British thriller in years". I would say, luckily for the British movie industry, this is just an opinion, and a very wrong one.
On the other hand, I would say it's not fair to blame froggie100, or the 26K Team, for the worst movie I had seen in years. If you want to blame someone, than blame Ben Wheatley Director/Writer of this monstrosity.
Do yourself a favor, and skip this one, you won't miss anything.
